definition: peaceful relations/harmonious
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
amicable/harmonious
to live in harmony/to get along with each other

sentences.english: Mrs…has never really got on with her daughter-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 老太太從未與兒媳婦兒真正和睦相處過。

sentences.english: They can never get along with each other.
sentences.chinese: 他們永遠無法彼此和睦相處。

sentences.english: They were a quiet and fond couple.
sentences.chinese: 他們夫婦一向和和睦睦，相親相愛。

sentences.english: I want to send you an old man, I wish you peace in the family the most favorable auspices.
sentences.chinese: 我要送你一個老人，祝你家庭和睦大吉大利。

sentences.english: Harmonious here dominant is worn everything, be being mixed spicily seldom appear caustically.
sentences.chinese: 和睦在這裏主導着一切，諷刺和挖苦是極少出現的。

sentences.english: Most daughter-in-laws can get along with their mother-in-laws.
sentences.chinese: 大多數媳婦都能與婆婆和睦相處。

sentences.english: Two cats and a mouse, two wives in one house, two dogs and a bone, never agree in one.
sentences.chinese: 兩貓逮一鼠，二婦侍一夫，雙狗爭一骨，永遠難和睦。

sentences.english: He is at enmity with his neighbours.
Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們務要追求和睦的事，與彼此建立德行的事。

sentences.english: Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.
sentences.chinese: 你們裏頭應當有鹽，彼此和睦。

sentences.english: As long as I am alive, I am fully committed to amity between Tibetans and Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 只要我活著，我會爲藏漢和睦貢獻全部。

sentences.english: It is not only the best as a matter of priciple , but it is the path of peace and honor.
sentences.chinese: 這不僅是最好的處世之道，更能給帶來和睦和尊重。

sentences.english: So then let us pursue what makes for peace and for mutual upbuilding .
sentences.chinese: 所以，我們總要追求和睦的事，與彼此造就的事。

sentences.english: She nurtured our religious faith, which kept our family close.
sentences.chinese: 她培養我們對宗教的信仰，這使全家親密和睦。

sentences.english: Too long have I lived among those who hate peace.
sentences.chinese: 我與那恨惡和睦的人，許久同住。

sentences.english: Mrs…and her daughter-in-law have never really got on.
sentences.chinese: 老太太從未與兒媳婦兒真正和睦相處過。

definition: harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
to live in harmony/to get along with each other
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
happy/blissful
harmonious/harmony/(euphemism) to censor
(of relations) joyous and harmonious
friendly/amicable/to keep up harmonious relations (with sb)
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
benevolent father, filial son (idiom)/natural love between parents and children
if the family lives in harmony all affairs will prosper (idiom)
husband and wife/married couple
family-like close relationship (idiom)
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
polite and amiable
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
prosperous/thriving/to prosper/to flourish
